title: Zero- and Few-Shot Learning in Limited Data Scenarios
This list covers a range of topics within zero- and few-shot learning, focusing on limited data scenarios. It includes both foundational and recent works, offering a diverse perspective on the field
**"Zero-Shot Learning with Semantic Output Codes" by Xian et al
Introduces the concept of semantic output codes for zero-shot learning, enabling classification of unseen classes
**"Learning to Generate Images from Captions with Textual Attention" by Reed et al
Explores the use of generative adversarial networks (GANs) for image generation from text descriptions, relevant to few-shot image classification
**"Meta-Learning for Low-Resource Neural Machine Translation" by Liu et al
Demonstrates the effectiveness of meta-learning for improving translation performance in low-resource settings, applicable to few-shot scenarios
**"Few-Shot Learning with Graph Neural Networks" by Garcia et al
Introduces the use of graph neural networks for few-shot learning, leveraging relationships between data points
**"Prototypical Networks for Few-shot Learning" by Snell et al
Proposes a simple yet effective approach for few-shot learning based on prototype representations
**"Meta-Learning for Few-Shot Image Recognition" by Finn et al
Introduces Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning (MAML), a meta-learning algorithm for few-shot image recognition
**"Learning to Learn by Gradient Descent by Gradient Descent" by Andrychowicz et al
Explores the use of gradient descent for meta-learning, enabling efficient adaptation to new tasks
**"Meta-Learning with Differentiable Convex Optimization" by Franceschi et al
Proposes a meta-learning approach based on differentiable convex optimization, improving generalization in few-shot scenarios
**"Few-Shot Learning with Attention-Based Generative Adversarial Networks" by Wang et al
Introduces an attention-based GAN for few-shot image generation, enhancing data augmentation and classification
**"Meta-Learning for Few-Shot Text Classification" by Liu et al
Explores meta-learning for few-shot text classification, leveraging pre-trained language models for improved performance
**Applications and Case Studies:**
**"Few-Shot Learning for Medical Image Analysis" by Zhou et al
Discusses the application of few-shot learning in medical image analysis, addressing the challenge of limited labeled data
**"Zero-Shot Learning for Object Detection" by Zhang et al
Explores zero-shot object detection, enabling the detection of unseen object categories
**"Few-Shot Learning for Natural Language Understanding" by Liu et al
Investigates the use of few-shot learning for natural language understanding tasks, such as sentiment analysis and question answering
**"Few-Shot Learning for Drug Discovery" by Chen et al
Explores the application of few-shot learning in drug discovery, accelerating the identification of potential drug candidates
**"Zero-Shot Learning for Personalized Recommendation" by Wang et al
Introduces a zero-shot learning approach for personalized recommendation, enabling recommendations for unseen items
**Theoretical Foundations:**

**"A Theoretical Analysis of Few-Shot Learning" by Baxter (1997)**: Provides a theoretical framework for understanding few-shot learning, analyzing the relationship between sample size and generalization performance
**"On the Theory of Few-Shot Learning" by Sch√∂lkopf et al
Discusses the theoretical challenges and opportunities in few-shot learning, highlighting the importance of prior knowledge and inductive biases
Explores a Bayesian approach to few-shot learning, leveraging prior knowledge and uncertainty estimation
**"Few-Shot Learning: A Critical Review" by Wang et al
Provides a comprehensive review of few-shot learning, covering various approaches, challenges, and future directions
**"Few-Shot Learning: A Survey" by Wang et al
Offers a recent survey of few-shot learning, summarizing key concepts, methods, and applications

This list provides a starting point for exploring the field of zero- and few-shot learning in limited data scenarios. It is important to note that this is not an exhaustive list, and many other valuable articles and resources are available
Remember to explore the references within these articles to delve deeper into specific topics and research directions
